alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 18 at 8:51AM HST until January 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI HAS BEEN CANCELLED... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND LANAI UNTIL 6 PM HST... ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF BIG ISLAND STILL IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST.... .A moderate size, medium period west northwest swell peaked earlier this morning and has rapidly fallen the past few hours. Thus, the High Surf Warning (HSW) has been downgraded to a High Surf Advisory (HSA) for most smaller island north and west-facing shores through today. There has been a significant enough westerly component to this swell to maintain warning level surf along various points of the leeward Big Island kona coastline. ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF BIG ISLAND UNTIL 6 PM HST... * WHAT...Surf heights 10 to 14 feet. * WHERE..West facing shores of Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect very strong breaking waves and powerful currents. Waves breaking in channel entrances may make navigating the channels dangerous.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
